oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIMENTAL ANALYSIS OF WAVE-INDUCED LIQUEFACTION IN A FINE SANDBED
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Suzuki, Kojiro
Takahashi, Shigeo
Kang, Yoon-Koo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: liquefaction
fine sandbed
experimental analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A series of experiments were conducted to examine wave-induced liquefaction in a loosely packed fine sandbed, which was specifically used to ensure the presence of residual excess pore pressure. Also observed was the compaction of a liquefied sandbed in response to cyclic wave loading; a phenomenon thought to reduce the possibility of liquefaction. In addition, pore water was supplied from the bottom of the sandbed such that the effect of underground water pressure on liquefaction could be clarified.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
